channel.title: Creepers
channel.description: Can we take a recount for creepers doing explosive damage in world 2? I know I'm not alone on this, there are a lot of people that have been annoyed by this as well. I don't mind them blowing up and killing me, but with there being so many and exploding and destroying stuff that you've worked hard to build is aggravating. =/

item.title: Creepers
item.dc:creator: @zuppers zuppers
item.description:
@zuppers wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:59, topic:423054”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=525707.msg3832047#msg3832047 date=1322648477]

Running towards a house doesn’t automatically mean creepers will follow you and explode, and you can defend against attacks that simple.

TNT though, however hard to acquire it is, once acquired makes it super-easy to grief whoever you want.
[/quote]I think we can all agree 90+% of griefer attacks happen when the owner is offline (hence the need for tools such has hawk). I said this before we even enabled PvP, but ‘defending’ against griefing isn’t plausible, and never has been.

The point is, TNT is hard to acquire, and no ‘join and grief’ person will ever have it.

I didn’t mean actively defend, I meant I can think of at least 3 different ways to defend your house from creepers walking up (or being ‘lured’) and exploding and hurting it. A water moat, a lava moat, or just a deep moat that they fall into and die from the fall damage? (the bottom would be lit, or just filled with water, it wouldn’t kill them maybe, but they can’t hurt anything exploding in water)

That is the type of creeper ‘defense’ I am talking about. Then if someone built a bridge over your moat or otherwise had to work to ‘lure’ creepers to grief you, there would be a hawk log of proof and it could be rolled back.

Is that not right?[/quote]If hawk can’t rollback TnT explosions (Which i’m pretty sure it can) then it wouldn’t be able to rollback creeper damage. Which is not something I want. Anyway are you going to give us the permissions to rollback explosions in the case of creepers being used to grief? Obviously you would have to use a radius parameter or it would rollback all explosions.

Read full topic
